difficulty_analysis.additional_info_needed: A clearer view of the dog's face and body, including its ears, eyes, and tail, would help in distinguishing between a Cocker Spaniel and a Toy Poodle.

region_descriptions:
The dog in the image has long, floppy ears that hang down on either side of its head. The fur on the ears is a rich, reddish-brown color, matching the coat of the dog. The texture appears soft and slightly wavy, with some strands of fur slightly longer than others, giving it a natural, slightly tousled look.

The facial structure includes a broad, flat face with a short muzzle. The eyes are dark and expressive, set within a rounded head. The nose is a darker shade of brown, almost black, which contrasts nicely with the lighter fur around it. The overall shape of the face is somewhat square, contributing to the dog's gentle and friendly appearance.

The dog's coat is medium-length and appears to be slightly wavy, with a rich reddish-brown hue. The texture of the fur looks soft and well-groomed, with no visible shedding in the image. The dog's expression is calm and attentive, with a slight tilt of the head that adds to its endearing quality.
